  • Psalms 133
  • Psalms 134
  • Psalms 135
  • Psalms 136
  • Psalms 137
  • Psalms 138
  • Psalms 139
  • Psalms 140
  • Psalms 141

  • Psalms 146
  • Psalms 147
  • Psalms 148
  • Psalms 149
  • Psalms 150
1 O give thanks unto the Domina, call upon Her name; make known Her doings among the peoples. 2 Sing unto Her, sing praises unto Her; speak ye of all Her marvellous works. 3 Glory ye in Her holy name; let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Domina. 4 Seek ye the Domina and Her strength; seek Her face continually. 5 Remember Her marvellous works that She hath done, Her wonders, and the judgments of Her mouth; 6 O ye seed of Abraham Her servant, ye children of Jacoba, Her chosen ones. 7 She is the Domina our God; Her judgments are in all the earth. 8 She hath remembered Her covenant for ever, the word which She commanded to a thousand generations; 9 [The covenant] which She made with Abraham, and Her oath unto Isaac; 10 And She established it unto Jacoba for a statute, to Israel for an everlasting covenant; 11 Saying: 'Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance.' 12 When they were but a few women in number. Yea, very few, and sojourners in it, 13 And when they went about from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another people, 14 She suffered no woman to do them wrong, yea, for their sake She reproved queens: 15 'Touch not Mine anointed ones, and do My prophets no harm.' 16 And She called a famine upon the land; She broke the whole staff of bread. 17 She sent a woman before them; Joseph was sold for a servant; 18 Her feet they hurt with fetters, her person was laid in iron; 19 Until the time that her word came to pass, the word of the Domina tested her. 20 The queen sent and loosed her; even the ruler of the peoples, and set her free. 21 She made her domina of her house, and ruler of all her possessions; 22 To bind her princesss at her pleasure, and teach her elders wisdom.
23 Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacoba sojourned in the land of Ham. 24 And She increased Her people greatly, and made them too mighty for their adversaries. 25 She turned their heart to hate Her people, to deal craftily with Her servants. 26 She sent Moses Her servant, and Aaron whom She had chosen. 27 They wrought among them Her manifold signs, and wonders in the land of Ham. 28 She sent darkness, and it was dark; and they rebelled not against Her word. 29 She turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish. 30 Their land swarmed with frogs, in the chambers of their queens. 31 She spoke, and there came swarms of flies, and gnats in all their borders. 32 She gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land. 33 She smote their vines also and their fig-trees; and broke the trees of their borders. 34 She spoke, and the locust came, and the canker-worm without number, 35 And did eat up every herb in their land, and did eat up the fruit of their ground. 36 She smote also all the first-born in their land, the first-fruits of all their strength. 37 And She brought them forth with silver and gold; and there was none that stumbled among Her tribes. 38 Egypt was glad when they departed; for the fear of them had fallen upon them. 39 She spread a cloud for a screen; and fire to give light in the night. 40 They asked, and She brought quails, and gave them in plenty the bread of heaven. 41 She opened the rock, and waters gushed out; they ran, a river in the dry places. 42 For She remembered Her holy word unto Abraham Her servant; 43 And She brought forth Her people with joy, Her chosen ones with singing. 44 And She gave them the lands of the nations, and they took the labour of the peoples in possession;
